00026 string Token::AsString() const {
00027   switch (type_) {
00028   case IDENT:    return "'" + string(pos_, end_ - pos_) + "'";
00029   case UNKNOWN:  return "unknown '" + string(pos_, end_ - pos_) + "'";
00030   case RULE:     return "'rule'";
00031   case BUILD:    return "'build'";
00032   case SUBNINJA: return "'subninja'";
00033   case INCLUDE:  return "'include'";
00034   case NEWLINE:  return "newline";
00035   case EQUALS:   return "'='";
00036   case COLON:    return "':'";
00037   case PIPE:     return "'|'";
00038   case PIPE2:    return "'||'";
00039   case TEOF:     return "eof";
00040   case INDENT:   return "indenting in";
00041   case OUTDENT:  return "indenting out";
00042   case NONE:     break;
00043   }
00044   assert(false);
00045   return "";
00046 }

00048 void Tokenizer::Start(const char* start, const char* end) {
00049   cur_line_ = cur_ = start;
00050   end_ = end;
00051 }
00052 
00053 bool Tokenizer::Error(const string& message, string* err) {
00054   char buf[1024];
00055   snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "line %d, col %d: %s",
00056           line_number_,
00057           (int)(token_.pos_ - cur_line_) + 1,
00058           message.c_str());
00059   err->assign(buf);
00060   return false;
00061 }
00062 
00063 bool Tokenizer::ErrorExpected(const string& expected, string* err) {
00064   return Error("expected " + expected + ", got " + token_.AsString(), err);
00065 }
00066 
00067 void Tokenizer::SkipWhitespace(bool newline) {
00068   if (token_.type_ == Token::NEWLINE && newline)
00069     Newline(NULL);
00070 
00071   while (cur_ < end_) {
00072     if (*cur_ == ' ') {
00073       ++cur_;
00074     } else if (newline && *cur_ == '\n') {
00075       Newline(NULL);
00076     } else if (*cur_ == '\\' && cur_ + 1 < end_ && cur_[1] == '\n') {
00077       ++cur_; ++cur_;
00078       cur_line_ = cur_;
00079       ++line_number_;
00080     } else if (*cur_ == '#' && cur_ == cur_line_) {
00081       while (cur_ < end_ && *cur_ != '\n')
00082         ++cur_;
00083       if (cur_ < end_ && *cur_ == '\n') {
00084         ++cur_;
00085         cur_line_ = cur_;
00086         ++line_number_;
00087       }
00088     } else {
00089       break;
00090     }
00091   }
00092 }
00093 
00094 bool Tokenizer::Newline(string* err) {
00095   if (!ExpectToken(Token::NEWLINE, err))
00096     return false;
00097 
00098   return true;
00099 }
00100 
00101 static bool IsIdentChar(char c) {
00102   return
00103     ('a' <= c && c <= 'z') ||
00104     ('+' <= c && c <= '9') ||  // +,-./ and numbers
00105     ('A' <= c && c <= 'Z') ||
00106     (c == '_') || (c == '$');
00107 }
00108 
00109 bool Tokenizer::ExpectToken(Token::Type expected, string* err) {
00110   PeekToken();
00111   if (token_.type_ != expected)
00112     return ErrorExpected(Token(expected).AsString(), err);
00113   ConsumeToken();
00114   return true;
00115 }
00116 
00117 bool Tokenizer::ReadIdent(string* out) {
00118   PeekToken();
00119   if (token_.type_ != Token::IDENT)
00120     return false;
00121   out->assign(token_.pos_, token_.end_ - token_.pos_);
00122   ConsumeToken();
00123   return true;
00124 }
00125 
00126 bool Tokenizer::ReadToNewline(string *text, string* err, size_t max_length) {
00127   // XXX token_.clear();
00128   while (cur_ < end_ && *cur_ != '\n') {
00129     if (*cur_ == '\\') {
00130       ++cur_;
00131       if (cur_ >= end_)
00132         return Error("unexpected eof", err);
00133       if (*cur_ != '\n') {
00134         // XXX we just let other backslashes through verbatim now.
00135         // This may not be wise.
00136         text->push_back('\\');
00137         text->push_back(*cur_);
00138         ++cur_;
00139         continue;
00140       }
00141       ++cur_;
00142       cur_line_ = cur_;
00143       ++line_number_;
00144       SkipWhitespace();
00145       // Collapse whitespace, but make sure we get at least one space.
00146       if (text->size() > 0 && text->at(text->size() - 1) != ' ')
00147         text->push_back(' ');
00148     } else {
00149       text->push_back(*cur_);
00150       ++cur_;
00151     }
00152     if (text->size() >= max_length) {
00153       token_.pos_ = cur_;
00154       return false;
00155     }
00156   }
00157   return Newline(err);
00158 }
00159 
00160 Token::Type Tokenizer::PeekToken() {
00161   if (token_.type_ != Token::NONE)
00162     return token_.type_;
00163 
00164   token_.pos_ = cur_;
00165   if (whitespace_significant_ && cur_indent_ == -1) {
00166     cur_indent_ = cur_ - cur_line_;
00167     if (cur_indent_ != last_indent_) {
00168       if (cur_indent_ > last_indent_) {
00169         token_.type_ = Token::INDENT;
00170       } else if (cur_indent_ < last_indent_) {
00171         token_.type_ = Token::OUTDENT;
00172       }
00173       last_indent_ = cur_indent_;
00174       return token_.type_;
00175     }
00176   }
00177 
00178   if (cur_ >= end_) {
00179     token_.type_ = Token::TEOF;
00180     return token_.type_;
00181   }
00182 
00183   if (IsIdentChar(*cur_)) {
00184     while (cur_ < end_ && IsIdentChar(*cur_)) {
00185       ++cur_;
00186     }
00187     token_.end_ = cur_;
00188     int len = token_.end_ - token_.pos_;
00189     if (len == 4 && memcmp(token_.pos_, "rule", 4) == 0)
00190       token_.type_ = Token::RULE;
00191     else if (len == 5 && memcmp(token_.pos_, "build", 5) == 0)
00192       token_.type_ = Token::BUILD;
00193     else if (len == 7 && memcmp(token_.pos_, "include", 7) == 0)
00194       token_.type_ = Token::INCLUDE;
00195     else if (len == 8 && memcmp(token_.pos_, "subninja", 8) == 0)
00196       token_.type_ = Token::SUBNINJA;
00197     else
00198       token_.type_ = Token::IDENT;
00199   } else if (*cur_ == ':') {
00200     token_.type_ = Token::COLON;
00201     ++cur_;
00202   } else if (*cur_ == '=') {
00203     token_.type_ = Token::EQUALS;
00204     ++cur_;
00205   } else if (*cur_ == '|') {
00206     if (cur_ + 1 < end_ && cur_[1] == '|') {
00207       token_.type_ = Token::PIPE2;
00208       cur_ += 2;
00209     } else {
00210       token_.type_ = Token::PIPE;
00211       ++cur_;
00212     }
00213   } else if (*cur_ == '\n') {
00214     token_.type_ = Token::NEWLINE;
00215     ++cur_;
00216     cur_line_ = cur_;
00217     cur_indent_ = -1;
00218     ++line_number_;
00219   }
00220 
00221   SkipWhitespace();
00222 
00223   if (token_.type_ == Token::NONE) {
00224     token_.type_ = Token::UNKNOWN;
00225     token_.end_ = cur_ + 1;
00226   }
00227 
00228   return token_.type_;
00229 }
00230 
00231 void Tokenizer::ConsumeToken() {
00232   token_.Clear();
00233 }

00235 MakefileParser::MakefileParser() : tokenizer_(false) {}
00236 
00237 bool MakefileParser::Parse(const string& input, string* err) {
00238   tokenizer_.Start(input.data(), input.data() + input.size());
00239 
00240   tokenizer_.SkipWhitespace(true);
00241 
00242   if (!tokenizer_.ReadIdent(&out_))
00243     return tokenizer_.ErrorExpected("output filename", err);
00244   if (!tokenizer_.ExpectToken(Token::COLON, err))
00245     return false;
00246   while (tokenizer_.PeekToken() == Token::IDENT) {
00247     string in;
00248     tokenizer_.ReadIdent(&in);
00249     ins_.push_back(in);
00250   }
00251   if (!tokenizer_.ExpectToken(Token::NEWLINE, err))
00252     return false;
00253   if (!tokenizer_.ExpectToken(Token::TEOF, err))
00254     return false;
00255 
00256   return true;
00257 }

00259 ManifestParser::ManifestParser(State* state, FileReader* file_reader)
00260   : state_(state), file_reader_(file_reader), tokenizer_(true) {
00261   env_ = &state->bindings_;
00262 }
00263 bool ManifestParser::Load(const string& filename, string* err) {
00264   string contents;
00265   if (!file_reader_->ReadFile(filename, &contents, err))
00266     return false;
00267   return Parse(contents, err);
00268 }
00269 
00270 bool ManifestParser::Parse(const string& input, string* err) {
00271   tokenizer_.Start(input.data(), input.data() + input.size());
00272 
00273   tokenizer_.SkipWhitespace(true);
00274 
00275   while (tokenizer_.token().type_ != Token::TEOF) {
00276     switch (tokenizer_.PeekToken()) {
00277       case Token::RULE:
00278         if (!ParseRule(err))
00279           return false;
00280         break;
00281       case Token::BUILD:
00282         if (!ParseEdge(err))
00283           return false;
00284         break;
00285       case Token::SUBNINJA:
00286       case Token::INCLUDE:
00287         if (!ParseFileInclude(tokenizer_.PeekToken(), err))
00288           return false;
00289         break;
00290       case Token::IDENT: {
00291         string name, value;
00292         if (!ParseLet(&name, &value, true, err))
00293           return false;
00294         if (value.substr(0, 9) == "ROOT_HACK") {
00295           // XXX remove this hack, or make it more principled.
00296           char cwd[1024];
00297           if (!getcwd(cwd, sizeof(cwd))) {
00298             perror("ninja: getcwd");
00299             return 1;
00300           }
00301           value = cwd + value.substr(9);
00302         }
00303         env_->AddBinding(name, value);
00304         break;
00305       }
00306       case Token::TEOF:
00307         continue;
00308       default:
00309         return tokenizer_.Error("unhandled " + tokenizer_.token().AsString(), err);
00310     }
00311     tokenizer_.SkipWhitespace(true);
00312   }
00313 
00314   return true;
00315 }
00316 
00317 bool ManifestParser::ParseRule(string* err) {
00318   if (!tokenizer_.ExpectToken(Token::RULE, err))
00319     return false;
00320   string name;
00321   if (!tokenizer_.ReadIdent(&name))
00322     return tokenizer_.ErrorExpected("rule name", err);
00323   if (!tokenizer_.Newline(err))
00324     return false;
00325 
00326   if (state_->LookupRule(name) != NULL) {
00327     *err = "duplicate rule '" + name + "'";
00328     return false;
00329   }
00330 
00331   Rule* rule = new Rule(name);  // XXX scoped_ptr
00332 
00333   if (tokenizer_.PeekToken() == Token::INDENT) {
00334     tokenizer_.ConsumeToken();
00335 
00336     while (tokenizer_.PeekToken() != Token::OUTDENT) {
00337       string key, val;
00338       if (!ParseLet(&key, &val, false, err))
00339         return false;
00340 
00341       string parse_err;
00342       if (key == "command") {
00343         if (!rule->ParseCommand(val, &parse_err))
00344           return tokenizer_.Error(parse_err, err);
00345       } else if (key == "depfile") {
00346         if (!rule->depfile_.Parse(val, &parse_err))
00347           return tokenizer_.Error(parse_err, err);
00348       } else if (key == "description") {
00349         if (!rule->description_.Parse(val, &parse_err))
00350           return tokenizer_.Error(parse_err, err);
00351       } else {
00352         // Die on other keyvals for now; revisit if we want to add a
00353         // scope here.
00354         return tokenizer_.Error("unexpected variable '" + key + "'", err);
00355       }
00356     }
00357     tokenizer_.ConsumeToken();
00358   }
00359 
00360   if (rule->command_.unparsed().empty())
00361     return tokenizer_.Error("expected 'command =' line", err);
00362 
00363   state_->AddRule(rule);
00364   return true;
00365 }
00366 
00367 bool ManifestParser::ParseLet(string* name, string* value, bool expand,
00368                               string* err) {
00369   if (!tokenizer_.ReadIdent(name))
00370     return tokenizer_.ErrorExpected("variable name", err);
00371   if (!tokenizer_.ExpectToken(Token::EQUALS, err))
00372     return false;
00373 
00374   // Backup the tokenizer state prior to consuming the line, for reporting
00375   // the source location in case of a parse error later.
00376   Tokenizer tokenizer_backup = tokenizer_;
00377 
00378   // XXX should we tokenize here?  it means we'll need to understand
00379   // command syntax, though...
00380   if (!tokenizer_.ReadToNewline(value, err))
00381     return false;
00382 
00383   if (expand) {
00384     EvalString eval;
00385     string eval_err;
00386     size_t err_index;
00387     if (!eval.Parse(*value, &eval_err, &err_index)) {
00388       string temp;
00389       // Advance the saved tokenizer state up to the error index to report the
00390       // error at the correct source location.
00391       tokenizer_backup.ReadToNewline(&temp, err, err_index);
00392       return tokenizer_backup.Error(eval_err, err);
00393     }
00394     *value = eval.Evaluate(env_);
00395   }
00396 
00397   return true;
00398 }
00399 
00400 bool ManifestParser::ParseEdge(string* err) {
00401   vector<string> ins, outs;
00402 
00403   if (!tokenizer_.ExpectToken(Token::BUILD, err))
00404     return false;
00405 
00406   for (;;) {
00407     if (tokenizer_.PeekToken() == Token::COLON) {
00408       tokenizer_.ConsumeToken();
00409       break;
00410     }
00411 
00412     string out;
00413     if (!tokenizer_.ReadIdent(&out))
00414       return tokenizer_.ErrorExpected("output file list", err);
00415     outs.push_back(out);
00416   }
00417   // XXX check outs not empty
00418 
00419   string rule_name;
00420   if (!tokenizer_.ReadIdent(&rule_name))
00421     return tokenizer_.ErrorExpected("build command name", err);
00422 
00423   const Rule* rule = state_->LookupRule(rule_name);
00424   if (!rule)
00425     return tokenizer_.Error("unknown build rule '" + rule_name + "'", err);
00426 
00427   if (!rule->depfile_.empty()) {
00428     if (outs.size() > 1) {
00429       return tokenizer_.Error("dependency files only work with single-output "
00430                            "rules", err);
00431     }
00432   }
00433 
00434   for (;;) {
00435     string in;
00436     if (!tokenizer_.ReadIdent(&in))
00437       break;
00438     ins.push_back(in);
00439   }
00440 
00441   // Add all order-only deps, counting how many as we go.
00442   int implicit = 0;
00443   if (tokenizer_.PeekToken() == Token::PIPE) {
00444     tokenizer_.ConsumeToken();
00445     for (;;) {
00446       string in;
00447       if (!tokenizer_.ReadIdent(&in))
00448         break;
00449       ins.push_back(in);
00450       ++implicit;
00451     }
00452   }
00453 
00454   // Add all order-only deps, counting how many as we go.
00455   int order_only = 0;
00456   if (tokenizer_.PeekToken() == Token::PIPE2) {
00457     tokenizer_.ConsumeToken();
00458     for (;;) {
00459       string in;
00460       if (!tokenizer_.ReadIdent(&in))
00461         break;
00462       ins.push_back(in);
00463       ++order_only;
00464     }
00465   }
00466 
00467   if (!tokenizer_.Newline(err))
00468     return false;
00469 
00470   // Default to using outer env.
00471   BindingEnv* env = env_;
00472 
00473   // But use a nested env if there are variables in scope.
00474   if (tokenizer_.PeekToken() == Token::INDENT) {
00475     tokenizer_.ConsumeToken();
00476 
00477     // XXX scoped_ptr to handle error case.
00478     env = new BindingEnv;
00479     env->parent_ = env_;
00480     while (tokenizer_.PeekToken() != Token::OUTDENT) {
00481       string key, val;
00482       if (!ParseLet(&key, &val, true, err))
00483         return false;
00484       env->AddBinding(key, val);
00485     }
00486     tokenizer_.ConsumeToken();
00487   }
00488 
00489   // Evaluate all variables in paths.
00490   // XXX: fast path skip the eval parse if there's no $ in the path?
00491   vector<string>* paths[2] = { &ins, &outs };
00492   for (int p = 0; p < 2; ++p) {
00493     for (vector<string>::iterator i = paths[p]->begin();
00494          i != paths[p]->end(); ++i) {
00495       EvalString eval;
00496       string eval_err;
00497       if (!eval.Parse(*i, &eval_err))
00498         return tokenizer_.Error(eval_err, err);
00499       string path = eval.Evaluate(env);
00500       if (!CanonicalizePath(&path, err))
00501         return false;
00502       *i = path;
00503     }
00504   }
00505 
00506   Edge* edge = state_->AddEdge(rule);
00507   edge->env_ = env;
00508   for (vector<string>::iterator i = ins.begin(); i != ins.end(); ++i)
00509     state_->AddIn(edge, *i);
00510   for (vector<string>::iterator i = outs.begin(); i != outs.end(); ++i)
00511     state_->AddOut(edge, *i);
00512   edge->implicit_deps_ = implicit;
00513   edge->order_only_deps_ = order_only;
00514 
00515   return true;
00516 }
00517 
00518 bool ManifestParser::ParseFileInclude(Token::Type type, string* err) {
00519   if (!tokenizer_.ExpectToken(type, err))
00520     return false;
00521   string path;
00522   if (!tokenizer_.ReadIdent(&path))
00523     return tokenizer_.ErrorExpected("path to ninja file", err);
00524   if (!tokenizer_.Newline(err))
00525     return false;
00526 
00527   string contents;
00528   if (!file_reader_->ReadFile(path, &contents, err))
00529     return false;
00530 
00531   ManifestParser subparser(state_, file_reader_);
00532   if (type == Token::SUBNINJA) {
00533     // subninja: Construct a new scope for the new parser.
00534     subparser.env_ = new BindingEnv;
00535     subparser.env_->parent_ = env_;
00536   } else {
00537     // include: Reuse the current scope.
00538     subparser.env_ = env_;
00539   }
00540 
00541   string sub_err;
00542   if (!subparser.Parse(contents, &sub_err))
00543     return tokenizer_.Error("in '" + path + "': " + sub_err, err);
00544 
00545   return true;
00546 }
